Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Ryan, can I get you a pencil from the warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, no thanks, I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, it's okay, I'm going down.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um... Yeah, absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, I'll be right back. [goes down pretend stairs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs uproariously and applauds] Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hands Ryan pencil] There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, can you get me a pen from down in the warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't mind if I do. See you in a minute. [goes back down pretend stairs and grabs pen from Stanley's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. [continues to laugh] Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There you go, fresh from the warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Michael, would you get me some coffee from the warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's coffee in the kitchen, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But the warehouse coffee tastes SO much better.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan and others
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yes, it's better. It's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [breathless] All right. Okay. [goes back down pretend stairs, crawls on belly to the kitchen for the coffee]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am like Bette Midler in For the Boys. Gotta keep the troops entertained.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [after Michael returns with coffee] With cream and sugar?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] So, I wanted to let you know that we lost Ed Truck.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oookay. Let me see if I have his cell. Is this the only reason you are calling, Jan? Or does somebody miss me?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, Ed died over the weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Attention, everybody. I just received a call from corporate with some news they felt that I should know first. My old boss Ed Truck has died.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael, that's such terrible news! You must feel so sad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I am. It's very sad. Because he was my boss.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's a shame. Ed was a good guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's right, you worked with him. So did Creed. Well, I'll be in my office in case anybody wants to drop by. Cheer me up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So did you hear the news?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The news that you just announced? That Ed died?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is there anything I can do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, gosh, what can anybody do, really? It's... pssssh... . He was almost 70. Circle of life.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holds out arms to Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Mmmmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [extricating herself] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: What's going on with Fairfield County schools? Karen, did you generate that price list?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Um, shoot. Uh, I will. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Okay, just get it done. Jim, will you make sure?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [coughing out his words] Suck up! Josh, did you hear what I said?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Thank you, everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [at vending machine] Dammit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Uh, nothing. They're just out of Herr's chips.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: But don't worry about it. My snack food doesn't fall under the umbrella of your authority.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm, that's where you're wrong. I'm your project supervisor today, and I have just decided that we're not doing anything until you get the chips that you require. So, I think we should go get some. Now, please.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: It's a real shame about Ed, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Must really have you thinkin'.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: About what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The older you get, the bigger the chance is you're gonna die. You knew that.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Ed was decapitated.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: He was drunk as a skunk, he was flying down Route 6. He slides under an 18 wheeler. Pop. It snaps right off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is the way to go. Instant death. Very smart.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You know a human can go on living for several hours after being decapitated.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're thinking of a chicken.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What did I say?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is just not the way a Dunder Mifflin manager should go, I'm sorry. Alone, out of the blue, and not even have his own head to comfort him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat] So, I'm not exactly sure how to say this...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ed was decapitated.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You said you didn't know how to say it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't... he was driving on the road and he went under a truck. And that's when his head was separated from the rest of him. And I will let you know more as soon as I find out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If my head ever comes off, I would like you to put it on ice.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I do not wanna talk about this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When I die, I wanna be frozen. And if they have to freeze me in pieces, so be it. I will wake up stronger than ever because I will have used that time to figure out exactly why I died and what moves I could have used to defend myself better now that I know what hold he had me in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't understand. We have a day honoring Martin Luther King, but he didn't even work here.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] I understand how you feel, Michael. I really do. So, would it be helpful to give everyone the day off?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You really don't get it, do you? You don't understand these people. That is the last thing that they would want is a day off.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, what would you suggest?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [thoughtfully] A statue.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Of Ed?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [scoffs] I'm not sure that's realistic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I think it would be very realistic, it would look just like him.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, that's not--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We could have his eyes light up, we could have his arms move...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is not a statue, that is a robot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think that is a great way to honor Ed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And how big do you want this robot?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Life-size.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm, no. Better make it two-thirds. Easier to stop if it turns on us.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What the hell are you two talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, we are talking about how to properly honor a man who gave his life as regional manager of this company, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know what, Michael? I've really tried with you today...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm hm.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ...and I have to get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh do you? You know who wished they could get back to work is Ed Truck.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So call me when you feel like having a real conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But Ed truck can't because he is--

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Goodbye. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: DEAD.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look [holding up sketch] I gave him a six foot extension cord so he can't chase us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, that is a "no" on the on the West Side Market.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Okay, great. I think that's enough. Can I get back to work now?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Never pegged you for a quitter.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I am NOT a quitter. I will do this all day if you want.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, all day.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. What are we doing? What's the game? I want in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, there's no game. We're just trying to get these chips for Karen.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you check the vending machine?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, the vending machines! How did we miss that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have no idea. We went right for the copier.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Mm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And then we checked the fax machine.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, nothing there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you check your... butt?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oohh... can you imagine how much blood there was? If it happened right here, it would reach all the way to reception. Probably get on Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay that's enough.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We do not wanna hear about this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you know what? I didn't wanna hear about it either, Stanley, but I did and now I can't stop picturing it. He leaves work, he's on his way home... wham! His cappa is detated from his head!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You have just spit on my face.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you know what? There's something wrong with you. There is something wrong with everybody in here. Because we have lost a member of our family and you don't wanna talk about it, you don't wanna think about it, you just wanna get back to work!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There are five stages to grief, which are [glancing at computer screen] denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance. And right now, out there, they're all denying the fact that they're sad. And that's hard. And it's making them all angry. And it is my job to try to get them all the way through to acceptance. And if not acceptance, then just depression. If I can get them depressed, then I'll have done my job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am going to throw you this ball. When you catch the ball, I want you to say the name of a person very important to you, somebody really special who died, and then I want you to say how they died, and you may cry if you like, that is encouraged. Let me just start. Let me show you how this works. I catch the ball. I lost Ed Truck. And... it feels like somebody took my heart and dropped it into a bucket of boiling tears... and at the same time, somebody else is hitting my soul in the crotch with a frozen sledgehammer... and then a third guy walks in and starts punching me in the grief bone... and I'm crying, and nobody can hear me, because I am terribly, terribly... terribly alone.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Excuse me, I'm sorry to interrupt, uh, I need to see Pam. There seems to be, like, something wrong with the radiator in her car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, fine. Hurry back.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [as they leave] There's nothing wrong with your car. I just thought you might like a break from the "grief counseling" session.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. I would like a break.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: How are you likin' the new car?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah? Sure is small. Got airbags?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think so. I don't know, I was mainly focused on the cup holders.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [laughs] Well, you're not still driving so fast, are you? Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hi, yeah. This is Mike from the West Side Market. Well, we get a shipment of Herr's salt and vinegar chips, and we ordered that about three weeks ago and haven't ... . yeah. You have 'em in the warehouse. Great. What is my store number... six. Wait, no. I'll call you back. [quickly hangs up] Shut up [to Karen].

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [laughing] Six?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Pam returns to conference room] Okay, we can start. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You waited for me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Pam, you're a member of this family. So we will wait for our family members. Phyllis, you wanna give it a shot?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [grabbing ball] I got it. When my mother was pregnant with me, they did an ultrasound and found she was having twins. When they did another ultrasound a few weeks later, they discovered, that I had resorbed the other fetus. Do I regret this? No. I believe his tissue has made me stronger. I now have the strength of a grown man and a little baby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, why don't you throw the ball to somebody else.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [throwing ball back] Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [returning ball to Stanley] Oh, yes Stanley. Come on. Your turn, you have to go.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I will NOT. [throws ball back]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... I'm going to toss the ball to Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let's see. I had an aunt that I was really close to. She was this amazing female boxer. Um, anyway, she was injured in a fight, and she was paralyzed. So, you can imagine how upset I was when I found out that she asked her manager to remove her breathing tube so she could die.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. If you wanna cry, that's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [catching ball] Thanks. Um, a few years ago, my family was on a safari in Africa and, um, my cousin, Mufasa was um, he was trampled to death by a pack of wildebeests and, um, we all... took it really hard. All of us kind of in the audience of what happened.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you want to talk about it anymore?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, it would probably take me like an hour and a half to tell that whole story.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Me, me, me, me, me me. [catches ball] Yes. Okay, um. I was trying to throw this party once. And everyone was over for the weekend. And then my uncle Bernie died, and so me and my best friend, we had to pretend like he was alive, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait a second. That's Weekend at Bernie's. [upset] Do you think that this is a game?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, there is a ball.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, we're starting over.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No, I'm done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are not leaving. No! We are not done.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We really have a lot of work to do right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Well, you know what? The guy who had my job has died. And nobody cares! And he sat at my desk. [breaking down]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, look. I know this is hard for you, but death's just a part of life. I mean, just this morning I saw a little bird fly into the glass doors downstairs and die. And I had to keep going.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do you know?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That that bird was dead? Did you check its breathing?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It was obvious...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Was its heart beating, Toby? Did you check it? No, of course you didn't. You're not a veterinarian. You don't know ANYTHING! [runs out of conference room crying]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael! [following Michael downstairs] Michael. Michael ...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [seeing bird] Oh, God!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in disgust] Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God! Oh my God, come on ...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Poor little fella.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh shhhh-oot!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He is a goner.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, he's not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, he's not. [cradling bird next to face]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, get him away from your head! He is covered in germs and bacteria!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you can't get diseases from a bird!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: A dead bird should not be in the kitchen!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We don't know if it's dead.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ugh, no that thing is dead.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You want me to flush him?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Attention everybody. This will only take a second of your time. Today at 4 p.m. we will be meeting in the parking lot to have a funeral service for this bird.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I have a lot of work to do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'm sorry to inconvenience you, Meredith. But that is what you do when things die. You honor them. Toby killed this bird. And now we are going to honor it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no! That's enough! You know what? This bird is dead. He died alone. The least you can do is be there for him now. [to Dwight] Find a box for him.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I'm calling a supermarket in Montreal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [on phone] Bonjour. Je cherche des tchips de la marque Herr's. Non? Ah... merci quand meme. Au revoir.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sounded good.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [crying]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's okay. It's okay. [pats Kelly on shoulder] Shh... yes, I know, I know. It's been a tough day, but it's good to let it show.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I mean, how many times to I have to confirm with Ryan [Michael walks away disgusted] for him to know that we have a date tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [trying to shove bird into a can] Argh... gah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are... What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? No, this is about the right size.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, God, no it's not! What is the matter with you? Is that the beak!?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, I grew up on a farm. We slaughtered a pig whenever we wanted bacon. My grandfather was reburied in an old oil drum. [pause] It would have fit if he had given me another minute.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need a box. I need a box. A small box... not too confining.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is it for the bird?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have it covered. [hands Dwight a decorated box]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If you wanna do something for the funeral...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, please.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe you could play a song on your recorder.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you have it with you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Always. [runs off]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did I wake up this morning thinking I'd be throwing together a bird funeral? You never can tell what your day here is gonna turn into.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [spotting Herr's chips on her desk] Where'd you find them?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where'd I find what?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I called the manufacturer, who referred me to distributor, who referred me to the vending machine company, who told me that they sell them in the machines in the building next door.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Glad you could all make it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You told us we had to.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, do you have the box?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Actually, I have it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You made this? Wow. [impressed] That's... that's very nice.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: When I was five my mom told me that my fish went to the hospital in the toilet and it never came back so we had a funeral for it. And I remember thinking "I'm a little too old for this." And I was five.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'd also like to say a few words if that's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do we know about this bird? You might think, "Not much. It's just a bird." But we do know some things. We know it was a local bird. Maybe it's that same bird that surprised Oscar that one morning with a special present from above.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, I remember that. That was SO funny.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And we know how he died. Flying into the glass doors. But you know what? I don't think he was being stupid. I think he just really, really wanted to come inside our building to spread his cheer and lift our spirits with a song.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's not a songbird.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shhh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: An impression, then. Lastly, we can't help but notice that he was by himself when he died, but of course, we all know that doesn't mean he was alone. Because I'm sure that there were lots of other birds out there who cared for him very much. He will not be forgotten.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [quickly] Amen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [begins playing recorder]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [singing] Just smile for me and let the day begin. You are the sunshine that lights my heart within... on the wings of love ...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Society teaches us that having feelings and crying is bad and wrong. Well, that's baloney, because grief isn't wrong. There is such a thing as good grief. Just ask Charlie Brown.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: Hey Jimmy. Want to see some pictures of my baby?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Umm... sure.

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: [shows picture] Here he is.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [chuckles] He's so cute.

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: And here's his first bath. Warning:

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Ed Truck died over the weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow. He...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah. And I know... I know he was your boss, so I thought you should know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Does his family know?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yes, they know, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But I'm the first in the office?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I guess, yes. I think it would be appropriate for you to make an announcement to your team, in case they want to pay their respects.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, yes, sure, I will do that...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...'Cause I'm the first to to find out. Nobody else knows and it is my responsibility to tell them. Well, good. How are you holding up? Want me to come over? [Jan hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ed Truck died. And it blows. They say that with grief, time makes it worse, which is bad for me because I found out before anybody so I've had more time to be sad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention, everyone. As you know, Ed Truck is dead. If you have any contact information on Rolodex files or in Microsoft Outlook, remove it now. Also, if you have any photographs, Pam will make her shredder available during lunch. That is all.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Remembering the dead doesn't help anybody. The way to best honor them is to figure out what killed them and prevent that thing from killing anyone ever again. In this case, some sort of steel exoskeleton to protect the neck, or else a device that allows the head to live separately from the body. I'm working on both.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would like you all to clear your schedules this afternoon, because I am telling corporate to send in a grief counselor. We need to find out what is blocking you. And that way, we'll be able to honor Ed the way he deserves to be honored. May he rest in peace.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: ...ces. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What was that, Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you said something, didn't you?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: May he rest in pieces. [chuckles] You know, because there's, like, two pieces of him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You think that's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, no need to call corporate. We are supposed to use Toby. He's trained as a grief counselor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, that can't be right.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, I am trained in grief counseling, but, ahh, I don't think that's what they need right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then I guess that makes you about the worst grief counselor in the world, doesn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: So how's your day going?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I will be spending the entire afternoon in grief counseling for someone I've never met.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: That sucks. [laughs] You guys got it much harder up here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Closer to the epicenter, I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [laughs] Cool, all right.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, as you know, Ed Truck passed away. So, I'm here to talk about it if anyone would like to.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Not really.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're ruining it, already. They should not be given the choice.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I did not know Ed Truck. So I will probably spend the day zoning out and planning my weekend. I think Ed would have wanted it that way.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Is anyone having any trouble eating?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Concentrating? Is anyone having trouble getting their work done today?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm having trouble getting my work done today.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, look, sometimes things crop up later. So, uhh, you should know I'm always available if anyone would like to talk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Wow. No. No. You are the most heartless, soulless person I've ever met.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, I'm sorry...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. Shh. Enough. It is going to take me hours to undo all the damage that your have done here. Dwight, Ryan, I want you to take the table out. We're gonna go on a five minute break, and when you come back, we're going to start with a clean slate, and, in the interim, I would like you to forget everything that Toby has said, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't think I'm overstating it when I say that Toby is a plague on this company. And he is worthless. You give people a chance to shine and they blow it, just like you knew they would. Grief counseling is not about, "Are you hungry? Would you like a sandwich?" These people are so far gone, you have to stick a food tube down their throats.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, part of the problem was that Toby talked at you. Now, I am going to talk with you. First off, I want you to be comfortable, because you really can't grieve if you're all tight and buttoned up. So, guys, loosen your ties, just take your jackets off if you want. Ladies, let your hair down. You know what? Even take your shoes off. I wanna get personal and I want you all to really open up. And I want you to know that anything and everything can be said.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay. I don't think Kevin should take his shoes off.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: My feet do not smell. Angela knows that hyperhidrosis is a medically diagnosed condition.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I found an exercise in Toby's binder that he managed to miss, that involves screening the part of you that says, "I don't wanna do that. I don't wanna talk about that. That is too private." Here's how it works. I'm going to throw you this ball.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, the ball-throwing exercise is in the binder. It's in the section marked, "Fun Ways To Make Brainstorming Sessions Explode With Excitement and Creativity."

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, my cousin Billy, they just had the twins.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, I thought that was supposed to be, like, next month.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know. I guess they couldn't wait. I'll bring in a picture if you...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'd love to see them. Oh, and tell them I say, "Congratulations."

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I should probably head back in.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But, umm, thanks for the break.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No problem.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in his office playing with a Dunder Mifflin Truck when it drops and the "head" of the Truck comes off]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael once told me that Home Alone is the saddest movie ever. When I asked him why, he said, "Because the whole family forgets the kid at home. There is nothing funny about that."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's... Hold it, hold it, hold it. Start, like, right in there. [Dwight digs hole in ground] Just dig.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ow! God!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, give it to me. You don't know what you're doing. All right. [Michael starts digging]

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey! What are you guys doing over there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing. Let's just... all right. [talks to warehouse guys] Guys, do you have a box we could use?
